# Welcome

## Topics

::: nonincremental
-   Unbalanced data
-   Choosing the "final" model
:::

## Computational setup



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
# load packages
library(tidyverse)
```

# From last time...

## Volcanoes

The data come from [The Smithsonian Institution](https://volcano.si.edu/), via [TidyTuesday](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2020/2020-05-12/readme.md).



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
volcano <- read_csv(here::here("slides", "data/volcano.csv"))
names(volcano)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 [1] "volcano_number"           "volcano_name"            
 [3] "primary_volcano_type"     "last_eruption_year"      
 [5] "country"                  "region"                  
 [7] "subregion"                "latitude"                
 [9] "longitude"                "elevation"               
[11] "tectonic_settings"        "evidence_category"       
[13] "major_rock_1"             "major_rock_2"            
[15] "major_rock_3"             "major_rock_4"            
[17] "major_rock_5"             "minor_rock_1"            
[19] "minor_rock_2"             "minor_rock_3"            
[21] "minor_rock_4"             "minor_rock_5"            
[23] "population_within_5_km"   "population_within_10_km" 
[25] "population_within_30_km"  "population_within_100_km"
```
:::
:::



## Data prep



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
volcano <- volcano %>%
  mutate(
    volcano_type = case_when(
      str_detect(primary_volcano_type, "Stratovolcano") ~ "Stratovolcano",
      str_detect(primary_volcano_type, "Shield") ~ "Shield",
      TRUE ~ "Other"
    ),
    volcano_type = fct_relevel(volcano_type, "Stratovolcano", "Shield", "Other")
  ) %>%
  select(
    volcano_type, latitude, longitude, 
    elevation, tectonic_settings, major_rock_1
    ) %>%
  mutate(across(where(is.character), as_factor))
```
:::



## Split into testing/training



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

volcano_split <- initial_split(volcano)
volcano_train <- training(volcano_split)
volcano_test  <- testing(volcano_split)
```
:::



## Specify a model



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
volcano_spec <- multinom_reg() %>%
  set_engine("nnet")

volcano_spec
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Multinomial Regression Model Specification (classification)

Computational engine: nnet 
```
:::
:::



## Create cross validation folds



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(9876)

volcano_folds <- vfold_cv(volcano_train, v = 5)
volcano_folds
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#  5-fold cross-validation 
# A tibble: 5 × 2
  splits            id   
  <list>            <chr>
1 <split [574/144]> Fold1
2 <split [574/144]> Fold2
3 <split [574/144]> Fold3
4 <split [575/143]> Fold4
5 <split [575/143]> Fold5
```
:::
:::



# Unbalanced data

## Unbalanced data

Remember that the observed volcano types are unbalanced:



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
volcano %>% 
  count(volcano_type)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 3 × 2
  volcano_type      n
  <fct>         <int>
1 Stratovolcano   461
2 Shield          118
3 Other           379
```
:::
:::



## Addressing unbalance {.smaller}

To address class unbalance, we generally use

-   **oversampling** data from levels that are less prevalent in the data
    -   e.g., `step_smote()`: Uses a technique called ["**S**ynthetic **M**inority **O**ver-sampling **Te**chnique"](https://jair.org/index.php/jair/article/view/10302/24590) to generate new examples of the minority class using nearest neighbors of these cases.
-   **downsampling** data from levels that are more prevalent in the data
    -   e.g., `step_downsample()`: Removes rows of a data set to make the occurrence of levels in a specific factor level equal.

## New recipe - oversample



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code  code-line-numbers="|7"}
volcano_rec3 <- recipe(volcano_type ~ ., data = volcano_train) %>%
  step_other(tectonic_settings) %>%
  step_other(major_rock_1) %>%
  step_dummy(all_nominal_predictors()) %>%
  step_zv(all_predictors()) %>%
  step_center(all_predictors()) %>%
  step_smote(volcano_type)
```
:::



## New recipe - downsample



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code  code-line-numbers="|7"}
volcano_rec4 <- recipe(volcano_type ~ ., data = volcano_train) %>%
  step_other(tectonic_settings) %>%
  step_other(major_rock_1) %>%
  step_dummy(all_nominal_predictors()) %>%
  step_zv(all_predictors()) %>%
  step_center(all_predictors()) %>%
  step_downsample(volcano_type)
```
:::



## New workflows



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
volcano_wflow3 <- workflow() %>%
  add_recipe(volcano_rec3) %>%
  add_model(volcano_spec)

volcano_wflow4 <- workflow() %>%
  add_recipe(volcano_rec4) %>%
  add_model(volcano_spec)
```
:::



## Fit resamples



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
volcano_fit_rs3 <- volcano_wflow3 %>%
  fit_resamples(
    volcano_folds, 
    control = control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE)
    )

volcano_fit_rs4 <- volcano_wflow4 %>%
  fit_resamples(
    volcano_folds, 
    control = control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE)
    )
```
:::



## Collect metrics



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
collect_metrics(volcano_fit_rs3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 3 × 6
  .metric     .estimator  mean     n std_err .config             
  <chr>       <chr>      <dbl> <int>   <dbl> <chr>               
1 accuracy    multiclass 0.510     5 0.0173  Preprocessor1_Model1
2 brier_class multiclass 0.296     5 0.00816 Preprocessor1_Model1
3 roc_auc     hand_till  0.694     5 0.0212  Preprocessor1_Model1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
collect_metrics(volcano_fit_rs4)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 3 × 6
  .metric     .estimator  mean     n std_err .config             
  <chr>       <chr>      <dbl> <int>   <dbl> <chr>               
1 accuracy    multiclass 0.492     5 0.0173  Preprocessor1_Model1
2 brier_class multiclass 0.300     5 0.00586 Preprocessor1_Model1
3 roc_auc     hand_till  0.682     5 0.0198  Preprocessor1_Model1
```
:::
:::



## ROC curves - oversampling



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
volcano_fit_rs3 %>%
  collect_predictions() %>%
  group_by(id) %>%
  roc_curve(
    truth = volcano_type,
    .pred_Stratovolcano:.pred_Other
  ) %>%
  autoplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](lec-26_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){fig-align='center' width=90%}
:::
:::



## ROC curves - downsampling



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
volcano_fit_rs4 %>%
  collect_predictions() %>%
  group_by(id) %>%
  roc_curve(
    truth = volcano_type,
    .pred_Stratovolcano:.pred_Other
  ) %>%
  autoplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](lec-26_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){fig-align='center' width=90%}
:::
:::



## Addressing unbalance

::: question
Can you think of any issues resulting from over/down sampling?
:::

# Final model

## The "chosen" model

Let's stick to the models without over/down sampling.

From the application exercise:



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
volcano_rec2 <- recipe(volcano_type ~ ., data = volcano_train) %>%
  step_other(tectonic_settings) %>%
  step_other(major_rock_1) %>%
  step_dummy(all_nominal_predictors()) %>%
  step_zv(all_predictors()) %>%
  step_center(all_predictors())

volcano_wflow2 <- workflow() %>%
  add_recipe(volcano_rec2) %>%
  add_model(volcano_spec)
```
:::



## Fitting the final model



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code  code-line-numbers="|1-4|6"}
final_fit <- last_fit(
  volcano_wflow2, 
  split = volcano_split
  )

collect_metrics(final_fit)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 3 × 4
  .metric     .estimator .estimate .config             
  <chr>       <chr>          <dbl> <chr>               
1 accuracy    multiclass     0.629 Preprocessor1_Model1
2 roc_auc     hand_till      0.734 Preprocessor1_Model1
3 brier_class multiclass     0.250 Preprocessor1_Model1
```
:::
:::



## Confusion matrix



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
collect_predictions(final_fit) %>%
  conf_mat(volcano_type, .pred_class)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
               Truth
Prediction      Stratovolcano Shield Other
  Stratovolcano            96     13    38
  Shield                    1      0     0
  Other                    21     16    55
```
:::
:::



## Confusion matrix - visualized



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
collect_predictions(final_fit) %>%
  conf_mat(volcano_type, .pred_class) %>%
  autoplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](lec-26_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){fig-align='center' width=90%}
:::
:::



## ROC curve



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
collect_predictions(final_fit) %>%
  roc_curve(truth = volcano_type, .pred_Stratovolcano:.pred_Other) %>%
  autoplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](lec-26_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){fig-align='center' width=90%}
:::
:::



## ROC curve - altogether

::: appex
📋 [github.com/sta210-s22/ae-11-volcanoes](https://github.com/sta210-s22/ae-11-volcanoes) - Exercise 3
:::



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](lec-26_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){fig-align='center' width=90%}
:::
:::



## Prediction



::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
final_fitted <- extract_workflow(final_fit)

new_volcano <- tibble(
  latitude = 35.9940,
  longitude = -78.8986,
  elevation = 404,
  tectonic_settings = "Subduction zone / Continental crust (>25 km)",
  major_rock_1 = "Andesite / Basaltic Andesite"
)

predict(
  final_fitted, 
  new_volcano, 
  type = "prob"
  )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 1 × 3
  .pred_Stratovolcano .pred_Shield .pred_Other
                <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl>
1               0.381       0.0379       0.581
```
:::
:::
